result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracey P Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment and treatment, domestic abuse counseling and parenting counseling. Must continue treating with therapist and must take all medications as prescribed. No violent contact with the victim. All contact must be civil. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must maintain compliance with all family court orders or paternity orders. Must continue paying any child support obligations. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes: Huber is granted for employment and treatment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.

Conditions as in Ct 1
Concurrent with: Ct 2
